newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds shot higher Monday, spurred by the rising Swiss franc and gains in German Bunds.
One Swiss-based trader said volume in cash and futures was below average. But he was positive for further gains.
The curve also showed only slight tendency towards steepening only late in the session.

The curve normally steepens when the franc strengthens. This may be partly due to speculators easing out of short franc positions, and possibly also on ideas the Swiss National Bank would react by putting liquidity into the market if the franc rose by enough to threaten the economic recovery.

The long end may continue to gain. One trader saw scope to 123 on the June Conf, and 103 on Bund futures. Demand for long maturities remained strong. The cash January 2014 0#CH148008= was quoted late at 101.20/101.70, yielding 4.105 percent, up from 100.65/101.15 Friday when it yielded 4.15 percent.
Euro Swiss francs up three at 98.24.
